channel.title: Projects on Nathaniel Woodward
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Nathaniel Woodward

item.title: Educational Practices in Large College Classroomsâ€” What Really Goes On?
item.description: A large-scale characterization of normative educational practices (e.g., course structure, teaching methods, learning activities) across more than 1,000 high-enrollment undergraduate courses at a large public institution over the last 5 years.

item.title: Estimating the Causal Effect of Retrieval Practice on Future Course Performance
item.description: This research builds directly upon my descriptive analysis (see below) by combining the syllabus dataset with student records to assess how prerequisite-course features affect student performance in their subsequent courses. Specifically, introductory courses high and low in retrieval-practice requirements were compared in terms of their students subsequent success using inverse propensity-score weighted logistic regressions with cluster-robust standard errors to improve causal inference.

item.title: Learning Analytics in Large College Classrooms
item.description: Recently, a large undergraduate course at the University of Texas has implemented a new class structure that replaces high-stakes tests with daily quizzes administered during class via computer. I propose an algorithmic innovation to optimize content delivery to improve learning outcomes.
